info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 6:02PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Cold and raw backcountry conditions expected through Saturday... An upper level low pressure system will continue to bring periods of rain through Saturday. Snow levels will mostly remain above 7000 feet, but may fall as low as 6000 feet during times of heavier precipitation. Any snow accumulations will be minimal, mostly ranging from trace amounts up to a couple inches over the highest mountain peaks. Temperatures will generally be in the 30s and 40s while winds gust up to 25 mph at times. The combination of the wind and wet conditions will make for cold and raw backcountry travel and activities. Outdoor recreationists should be prepared for the early winter conditions. Cold and wet weather may result in hypothermia for those not properly dressed. Anyone traveling will encounter wet roadways and unpaved surfaces may become muddy and impassible.
